While wielding a weapon with the {@itemProperty R||Reach} property, when you expend a ki point to use your Step of the Wind feature, your jump distance is instead tripled for the turn, and you gain advantage on your next melee weapon attack you make this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Serpent Strikes
entries: You learn the following techniques to augment your attacks:

items: {@bold Cobra Strike} When a creature you can see moves into your reach, you can use your reaction to make one attack against that creature.
{@bold Python Strike} When you hit a creature with an opportunity attack, you can also use your Stunning Strike on that attack without expending a ki point.

{@bold Viper Strike} Once on your turn when you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend 1 or more ki points, up to a number equal to your proficiency bonus. The attack deals {@damage 1d6} poison damage, plus {@damage 1d6} additional poison damage per ki point spent, and the target is poisoned until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Serpent Stances
entries: At the start of your turn, you can adopt a serpent stance (no action required). When you do, choose one of the following serpent stances, which last until you are {@condition incapacitated} or use this feature again.

items: {@bold Anaconda Stance.} While using this stance, increase the reach of your melee weapon attacks and unarmed strikes by 10 feet.
{@bold Black Mamba Stance.} While using this stance, once per turn when you miss with a weapon attack, you may make an additional melee attack as part of the same action.
{@bold Couatl Stance.} While using this stance, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.
{@bold Marilith Stance.} While using this stance, you can take one reaction on every turn in combat, instead of once each round.

subclassFeature.name: Supreme Serpent
entries: When you adopt a Serpent Stance, you can instead adopt two serpent stances at the same time, gaining the benefits of both effects.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Hexes
entries: Those who swear an oath of hexes are sworn to witch covens, fey creatures, and occult deities of magic, fate, and death. In exchange, this sacred oath empowers paladins with fickle magic to curse those who would try to tempt fate or escape the ire of the Old Gods.

entries.name: Tenets of Hexes
entries: {@bold Serve the Occult.} Deities with power over the future have infused you with occult magic. Through your oath, you are made a mortal vessel for their inscrutable will.

{@bold Keeper of Secrets.} This world harbors dark secrets which are best kept long forgotten. You stand as the protectors of those secrets, preventing them from falling into the hands of weak-willed mortals who would misuse them to evil ends.
{@bold Arbiter of Fate.} The strands of fate were woven long ago, and it is folly to fight them. Misfortune befalls all.

{@bold Show No Mercy.} Though some think your strange powers are dark or corrupted, you vanquish evil with the very curses and magics that they would use against you. Show no mercy to those who resist their fate.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed in the Oath of Hexes Spells table. See the Sacred Oath class feature for how oath spells work.

entries.caption: Oath of Hexes Spells
rows: {@spell hellish rebuke|PHB}, {@spell Tasha's hideous laughter||hideous laughter}, {@spell eldritch blast|PHB}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: You gain the following Channel Divinity options:

items: {@bold Curse of Hexes} As an action, you curse one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. When you curse a target, choose an ability score. The chosen creature has disadvantage on attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks using that ability score for one minute or until it drops to 0 hit points or falls unconscious. At the end of each of the cursed creature's turns, it can make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a successful save, the curse ends.

{@bold Curse of Torment} As a bonus action, you curse one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. Searing pain wracks the target for one minute. While suffering this pain, it takes necrotic damage equal to your paladin level at the start of each of its turns. Each time it takes this damage, it can make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a successful save, the pain ends.

subclassFeature.name: Bewitching Aura
entries: You emit an eldritch aura out to a range of 10 feet. When an enemy hits you or a creature within 10 feet of you with an attack, you can use your reaction to force that enemy to make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, you can magically redirect the attack to another creature of your choice within 10 feet of you and within range of the attack. The new target is hit by the attack and suffers all damage and effects.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Reversal of Fortune
entries: Whenever a creature scores a critical hit against you, the next time you hit that creature with an attack, that attack automatically becomes a critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Death Hex
entries: A creature afflicted by your Curse of Hexes or Curse of Torment becomes vulnerable to all damage.

subclassFeature.name: Urban Ranger
entries: Urban rangers are less accustomed to nature and the wilds, but to the rooftops and guerilla tactics of city warfare. Training for maneuverability and stealth amongst ruined buildings, and twisting streets, these rangers are at home amongst the ruins and rubble. They are agile runners, skilled snipers, and always able to know where the best vantage points against their enemies are.

subclassFeature.name: Urban Ranger Magic
entries: You learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Urban Ranger Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Gutter Runner
entries: You gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed, and proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} and {@skill Acrobatics} skills if you don't already have it. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of those proficiencies.

In addition, when you take the {@action Dash} action on your turn, you can move through other creature's spaces without penalty (but not stop there). When you do, your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Vantage Point
entries: When you make a ranged weapon attack against a creature, you gain advantage on the attack roll if there are no other creatures within 5 feet of that target, or if you are 20 feet or more above the target and that creature doesn't have cover.

subclassFeature.name: Rooftop Mobility
entries: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet, and you can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action on your turn. In addition, you have mastered the means to propel yourself forwards and upwards when you move and climb. When you take the {@action Dash} action on your turn, your jumping distance increases to match your movement speed.

subclassFeature.name: Perfect Position
entries: When you attack a creature with the benefits of your Vantage Point feature, you deal an additional {@damage 2d6} damage to the target, and score a critical hit on a d20 roll of 19-20.

subclassFeature.name: Sitting Duck
entries: Once on your turn, when you hit a creature that did not move on its last turn with a ranged weapon attack, that attack automatically becomes a critical hit.

subclassFeature.name: Smuggler
entries: Whenever someone has something of value, usually illegal, that they need delivered discreetly, they call a smuggler. These rogues are experts at concealing, stealing, and blending in unnoticed to the common folk. They are also uniquely skilled at turning opportunities around when things are not going their way, and using whatever means necessary to achieve their goals. These slippery rogues are crafty and cunning and should not be underestimated.

subclassFeature.name: Pack Rat
entries: Provided you have your hands free, you can retrieve and stow handheld items or weapons on your person as part of the action you use them (including the {@action Attack} action).

You have accumulated a collection of miscellaneous gear, which you conceal on your person for emergencies. This gear is kept in a bag, jacket, or backpack that you carry with you. You can retrieve any nonmagical, inanimate item detailed in the Adventuring Gear section of the Core Rules with a value of 25 gp or less and weighing less than 10 pounds. You may use this feature to retrieve a number of items equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.
Though otherwise functional, objects retrieved using this feature are visibly worthless junk.

subclassFeature.name: Tricks of the Trade
entries: You gain proficiency with the disguise kit, land vehicles, and water vehicles.
Whenever you make an ability check related to smuggling or concealing objects you add double your proficiency bonus to the check.

If you are driving a wagon, boat, or other vehicle with which you are proficient, you know tricks and modifications that you can make to build simple smuggler compartments in almost any vehicle. After one hour of work, you can conceal up to one-quarter of the maximum carrying capacity of the vehicle at the Game Master's discretion. It takes one hour of work to modify a Large or smaller vehicle, eight hours to modify a huge vehicle, and two days to modify a Gargantuan or larger vehicle.

subclassFeature.name: Blend Into the Crowd
entries: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by two or more creatures that aren't hostile to you. Those creatures must be within 5 feet of each other and at least your size or larger.

subclassFeature.name: Slip Past
entries: You can move through another creature's space, including hostile creatures, without penalty when you take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action on your turn.
When you do so, you gain advantage on attack rolls against any creature whose space you moved through this turn.

subclassFeature.name: Never Tell Me the Odds
entries: Sometimes when the odds seem against you is the exact right moment to pull a fast one on your foes, using the chaos to get in a vital strike.
You can still apply your Sneak Attack even when you have disadvantage on the attack roll, so long as you meet the other conditions for making a Sneak Attack.

subclassFeature.name: Smuggled Spells
entries: Beginning at 17th level, you can store spells cast by other creatures in your bag. Your bag can store up to 6 levels worth of spells at a time.

Any creature can cast a spell of 1st through 5th level into your bag by touching the bag as the spell is cast. The spell has no effect, other than to be stored in your bag. If your bag can't hold the spell, the spell is expended without effect. The level of the slot used to cast the spell determines how much space it uses.

Alternatively, you can place a {@item spell scroll} in the bag. The spell is cast and stored in your bag and the spell scroll is destroyed. You can cast any spell stored in your bag. The spell uses the slot level, spell save DC, spell attack bonus, and spellcasting ability of the original caster, but is otherwise treated as if you cast the spell. The spell cast from the bag is no longer stored in it, freeing up space.

subclassFeature.name: Delerium Soul
entries: Delerium is naturally drawn to magic and can twist and augment its presence in unnatural and unpredictable ways. Some who ventured into the ruins of Drakkenheim are twisted by the eldritch powers and emerge infused with contaminated energies. They become a living vessel for the Arcane Anomalies and twisting realities found within the ruins.

subclassFeature.name: Delerium Spells
entries: Imbued with the eldritch power of delerium, your magic is fundamentally contaminated. You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Delerium Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.
Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be a contaminated spell.

entries.caption: Delerium Soul Spells
rows: {@spell vanish to the space between worlds|GuideDrakkenheim}, {@spell weave the elder sign|GuideDrakkenheim}

subclassFeature.name: Mutant Manifestation
entries: When you finish a long rest, you can choose to roll twice on the Mutations table (see page 231), and must select one of the results. You gain that mutation, which remains until you finish a long rest, even if you don't currently have any contamination levels.

subclassFeature.name: Contaminated Sorcery
entries: When you cast a contaminated spell, you can cast it by expending a spell slot as normal or by spending a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level. If you cast the spell using sorcery points, you don't gain a Contamination Level by casting the spell, and if the spell requires delerium as a material component, it is not consumed by the spell. In addition, casting a contaminated spell in this manner immediately causes an Arcane Anomaly (see page 233).

subclassFeature.name: Incomprehensible Arcana
entries: You can tap into contaminated energy to cast a spell you do not know. You can cast any spell from any class spell list. The spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and you must expend a spell slot as normal. Casting the spell uses the spell's normal casting time, and if the spell has material components, you must provide those components as normal. As part of casting the spell, but before the spell takes effect, you gain a number of Contamination Levels equal to half the spell's level, rounded down (minimum of one). You can't prevent or reduce these Contamination Levels by any means, but you can remove them as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Chaos Theory
entries: Once per turn when you make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can choose to trigger an Arcane Anomaly (see page 233). If you do, you make that roll with advantage. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Cosmic Patron
entries: Some warlocks gain their eldritch power from the very cosmos, answering to entities of space, the constellations, planets, and moons. A warlock swearing fealty to a Cosmic patron typically believes they speak to gods, or god-like beings, but these entities are shrouded in mystery, their appearance incomprehensible and horrible, and their divine power is bestowed into the warlock from the stars and galaxies beyond.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Cosmos lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Cosmic Attributes
entries: You take on an otherworldly cosmic appearance or essence. Choose one or more of the attributes listed below, decide your own, or roll randomly to determine how the cosmic powers bestowed into you take form.

rows: Your eyes become pools of inky black with small galaxies floating within them. To look into them is as if floating through the cosmos lost in the void of space.
Your touch becomes cold as ice and your skin becomes pale. Some might think you undead or sickly. You appear as if you had died in the cold of space.

Your voice has a slight echoing nature to it. As if there is more than one entity speaking through you. Your own voice is most prominent but when listening carefully one can make out a chorus of celestial voices speaking through you.
You give off a faint smell of ozone — acrid and sulfuric, as if lightning had just struck nearby. It seems unnatural and otherworldly.
You develop a third eye in the middle of your forehead that is unblinking, and seems to pierce into people's minds as it stares upon them.
Your veins glow with a soft radiant light, giving you the appearance of a walking constellation of stars and cosmic energy.

subclassFeature.name: Shooting Stars
entries: Beginning at first level, you learn the {@spell eldritch blast} cantrip if you don't know it already. It doesn't count against the number of warlock cantrips you know. When you cast {@spell eldritch blast}, you can have it deal radiant damage instead of force damage.

subclassFeature.name: Cosmic Guidance
entries: You can speak, read, and write Celestial and Deep Speech. In addition, you learn the {@spell guidance} cantrip. It doesn't count against the number of warlock cantrips you know. Additionally, you may cast the spell {@spell augury} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Orbit
entries: Once per turn when you miss a creature with {@spell eldritch blast}, the beam returns to you as an orbiting comet around your head. While you have an orbiting comet, you can absorb its energy to do the following:

items: {@bold Cosmic Power.} Once on your turn when you cast {@spell eldritch blast}, you can consume one orbiting comet to fire an additional beam.
{@bold Interception.} You can use your reaction to intercept a melee or ranged attack, gaining resistance to the damage from that attack.
{@bold Lightspeed.} As a bonus action, you can consume a comet to teleport 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

entries: You can have a maximum number of orbiting comets equal to your proficiency bonus. As long as you have comets, you glow with bright light out to 20 feet, and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The comets last until you finish a short or long rest, or until you dismiss them (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Meteoric Impact
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with {@spell eldritch blast}, you can cause the beam to explode. Each creature within 10 feet of the target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} fire damage.
The damage increases to {@damage 4d6} damage at 14th level, and to {@damage 5d6} damage at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Supernova
entries: Charged by the energy of the stars, you gain additional benefits from the otherworldly entities lurking in the deep void of space.

items: When you cast {@spell eldritch blast}, you can fire one additional beam.
Whenever you score a critical hit with {@spell eldritch blast}, you can use your Meteoric Impact feature an additional time that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Flesh Patron
entries: A Warlock of the Flesh has made a pact with an entity so alien and unknown that its mere existence is enough to cause madness in most people. These warlocks have allowed an alien entity to inhabit their bodies, answering to some ancient and eldritch thing from beyond comprehension. This entity creates a symbiotic relationship with the host, granting them powers while reshaping and twisting their form.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Flesh lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Reshape Flesh
entries: As an action, you can take on a reshaped form, which lasts until you become incapacitated, use an action to change back, or use this feature again. When you do, choose from one of the reshaped forms below:

items: {@bold Inverse Kneecaps.} Your legs become more powerful, and your knees now bend the opposite direction. While in this form, you increase your walking speed by 10 feet, and you can double your long and high jump distance.

{@bold Aquatic Attributes.} You grow gills and your skin becomes slimy, the flesh between your fingers and toes becomes webbed. While in this form, you can breathe underwater, and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

{@bold Natural Weapons.} You grow claws, fangs, spines, horns, or a different natural weapon of your choice. Your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, as appropriate to the natural weapon you chose, and you are proficient with your unarmed strikes. You can use your Charisma modifier for attack and damage rolls. The damage of your unarmed strikes increases as you gain levels in this class: {@damage 2d6} damage beginning at 10th level, and {@damage 3d6} damage at 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Body Modification
entries: When you choose your reshaped form, you can choose any two options available to you.
You gain the following additional options when you take on a reshaped form:

items: {@bold Gelatin Bones.} Your skin looks loose and saggy as you struggle to maintain your structure. You can now fit into spaces as small as one inch in diameter and gain advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks.

{@bold Change Appearance.} You transform your appearance. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your statistics change. You can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same. For example, if you're bipedal, you can't use this spell to become quadrupedal.

{@bold Combat Instincts.} You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. In addition, your natural weapons and unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

{@bold Spider Claws.} Your hands and feet grow strange mucus-slicked insectoid features that allow you to climb surfaces. You gain a climb speed equal to your walk speed and can stick to ceilings as well without needing to make an ability check.

subclassFeature.name: Physiological Mastery
entries: You gain the following additional options when you take on a reshaped form:

items: {@bold Aerial Adaptation.} Feathered or batlike wings rip out of your back, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

{@bold Toxic Fumes.} A cloud of noxious gas seeps from your pores, you appear sickly, and green slime oozes from your pores. You have disadvantage on Charisma checks while in this form, but any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of you takes {@damage 2d6} poison damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.
{@bold Hardened Skin.} You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Unfathomable Horror
entries: You can choose any three available options when you transform using your Reshape Flesh feature. Additionally, you are immune to any spell or effect that would alter your form against your will.

subclassFeature.name: Malfeasant
entries: The path of the Malfeasant wizard unlocks eldritch abilities lesser spellcasters consider to be unnatural. Malfeasant wizards flout the restrictions of the Amethyst Academy which bar such forbidden magic. As a result, most hide from the Academy and the Silver Order, having been expelled from the school for their pursuit of such dark and dangerous magic.

subclassFeature.name: Forbidden Study
entries: Whenever you gain a wizard level, you can add one Contaminated Spell to your spellbook. This is in addition to the two wizard spells you normally learn. You don't need to research or discover the spell beforehand, instead developing the spell as a result of your own research.

subclassFeature.name: Horrific Potential
entries: If you undergo a Monstrous Transformation, the form chosen by the Game Master must have a Challenge Rating equal to at least half your level (rounded down), but can't have a Challenge Rating greater than your level.

subclassFeature.name: Anomalous Materials
entries: You've learned how to cast Contaminated Spells while shielding yourself from their harmful energies. You don't gain a Contamination Level when you cast a Contaminated Spell. Any delerium required as material components for the spell isn't consumed when you cast the spell in this way, but you must still provide those components. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Increased Threshold
entries: Your dedicated long-term exposure to eldritch contamination has inured your body to its effects, and you can withstand a greater accumulation of contamination.
You gain proficiency in Constitution saving throws and resistance to necrotic damage.

When determining which Symptoms apply to you as a result of gaining Eldritch Contamination, you are treated as having a number of Contamination Levels equal to half your current Contamination Level instead, rounded down. For example, if you gained 5 Contamination Levels, you would only suffer the Symptoms of Contamination Level 2. Thus, you would need to gain 12 Contamination Levels to undergo a Monstrous Transformation, instead of 6.

In the same manner, when checking to see if you develop a mutation when you gain a new Contamination Level, you are treated as having a number of Contamination Levels equal to half your current Contamination Level instead, rounded down. For example, if you gained 4 Contamination Levels, you would only develop a new mutation if the result of the {@dice 1d6} roll is 2 or lower.

Note that if you have six or more contamination levels, being subject to the {@spell purge contamination|GuideDrakkenheim} spell will cause you to gain six (or more) levels of exhaustion, and you'll die as a result.

subclassFeature.name: Expel Contaminants
entries: You've discovered an arcane method to safely discharge eldritch pollutants from your own body. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can reduce your Contamination Level by an amount equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down).

subclassFeature.name: Contaminated Casting
entries: You can gain Contamination Levels to empower your spells. Whenever you cast a spell which has increased effects from being cast using a higher-level spell slot, you can increase the spell's level without expending a higher-level spell slot. For each level you increase the spell's level in this way, you gain 1 Contamination Level. For example, if you wanted to cast the 3rd-level spell fireball as if it was a 5th-level spell, you could expend a 3rd-level spell slot and gain 2 Contamination Levels instead. You can't use this feature on a Contaminated Spell, nor to increase a spell's level higher than your highest level spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Stabilizing Focus
entries: While you are concentrating on a spell, you ignore the Symptoms of any Contamination Levels you have gained, except for a Monstrous Transformation.

subclassFeature.name: Apotheosis in Flesh
entries: If you undergo a Monstrous Transformation, you maintain control over your new form for 1 minute. Unless you die, you revert back to your original form after 24 hours. When you assume your original form, you gain the benefits of a long rest and all Contamination Levels are removed from you. The Game Master determines what memories you retain from your transformation, if any. Regardless, the harrowing experience will haunt you in your nightmares forever, and you gain one form of Drakkenheim Madness.

monster.name: Corpsewrought Creature

hp.special: 5 + five times your apothecary level (the creature has a number of hit dice [d12s] equal to your apothecary level)

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the corpsewrought creature is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4 plus PB} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 4} bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: The Thing with the Writhing Tail
monster.summonedBySpell: Summon the Thing with the Writhing Tail|GuideDrakkenheim

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The thing sees {@condition invisible} creatures and can see into the Ethereal Plane.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thing makes a number of claw attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@dice 1d6 + summonSpellLevel + 4} slashing damage plus {@damage 2d6} cold damage.

action.name: Eldritch Hiss
entries: The thing whispers a terrible truth to one creature it can see within 5 feet. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 4d6} psychic damage and must immediately use its reaction, if available, to move as far as its speed allows away from the thing. The creature doesn't move into obviously dangerous ground, such as a fire or a pit.

action.name: Thought Tendril
entries: The thing psychically lashes out at one creature it can see within 5 feet. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 4d6} psychic damage, and it can't take a reaction until the end of its next turn. Additionally, on its next turn, it must choose whether it gets a move, an action, or a bonus action; it gets only one of the three.

trait.name: Amorphous Form (Animated Sludge, Entropic Flame, and Living Haze)
entries: The delerium elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Deep Haze (Living Haze Only)
entries: The delerium elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. A creature who enters or starts its turn in the same space as the delerium elemental must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage on a failed saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The delerium elemental makes a number of slam or hurl flame attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 4 + summonSpellLevel} bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hurl Flame (Entropic Flame Only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 2 + summonSpellLevel} fire damage. Before or after making this attack, the delerium elemental can teleport up to 10 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Grasping Tide (Animated Sludge Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}{@damage 2d8 + 4 + summonSpellLevel} bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16).

action.name: Shard Slam (Walking Geode Only)
entries: A creature hit by the delerium elemental's melee attacks must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed saving throw, it is pushed 10 feet away from the delerium elemental.

renames.rename: Amorphous Form (Animated Sludge, Entropic Flame, and Living Haze)

items.name: Multiattack
entries: Animated Sludge makes a number of slam attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

renames.rename: Amorphous Form (Animated Sludge, Entropic Flame, and Living Haze)
Amorphous Form (Animated Sludge, Entropic Flame, and Living Haze)

items.name: Multiattack
entries: Living Haze makes a number of slam attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

trait.names: Amorphous Form (Animated Sludge, Entropic Flame, and Living Haze)

items.name: Multiattack
entries: Walking Geode makes a number of slam attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The minstrel casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as their spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks):

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target.  {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft, or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Inspiring Word
entries: The minstrel chooses one creature it can see within 60 feet who can hear them. Once any time before the start of the minstrel's next turn, that creature can roll {@dice 1d6} and add the number rolled to the result of an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes.

trait.name: Bold
entries: The liege has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The liege makes two melee or ranged attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft, one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage when used in two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Battle Command {@recharge 4}
entries: The liege chooses an ally they can see within 60 feet, and issues one of the following battle commands to  that ally:

items.name: For Glory!
entries: The ally can use their reaction to make a melee or ranged weapon attack.

items.name: Move It!
entries: The ally can use their reaction to move their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

items.name: Never Falter!
entries: The liege ends one effect which {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} that ally.

action.name: Poison Needle
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Medical Treatment (3/Day)
entries: The doctor touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 ({@dice 4d8 + 2}) hit points, and the doctor ends either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition poisoned}.

bonus.name: Diagnosis
entries: The doctor takes the Help action.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The surgeon casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as their spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Surgical Strike
entries: The surgeon has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if no other creature is within 5 feet of the target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The surgeon makes two melee or ranged attacks.

action.name: Poison Needle
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Fetid Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage, and 4 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The plague doctor casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as their spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Gas Mask
entries: The plague doctor is unaffected by their own spells.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The plague doctor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Toxicology
entries: The plague doctor's spells and abilities that inflict poison damage bypass enemies resistance to poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The plague doctor makes two melee or ranged attacks.

action.name: Poison Needle
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 4d4 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Infliction
entries: Ranged spell Attack: {@hit 9} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) necrotic damage, if the target is suffering from a disease or the {@condition poisoned} condition, it takes 22 ({@dice 4d10}) additional necrotic damage.

trait.name: Brawler
entries: The reaver has advantage on attack rolls against a target it has {@condition grappled}. Additionally, the reaver can grapple a target even when wielding a two-handed weapon.

trait.name: Great Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the reaver to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is from a critical hit. On a success, the reaver drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The reaver makes two greataxe attacks. If it hits with one of these attacks, it can grapple the target as a bonus action.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Smash
entries: The reaver can use a creature it is grappling as an improvised weapon against another with a +6 attack bonus. If the attack hits, both the {@condition grappled} creature and the target take 10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Flamekeeper casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as their spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage when used in two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Searing Light
entries: The Flamekeeper speaks a prayer as they project a radiant beam at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target suffers 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} until the start of the Flamekeeper's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition blinded}.

action.name: Radiant Flames
entries: The Flamekeeper channels divine power into a burst of holy fire. Creatures of the Flamekeeper's choice within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, each target takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) radiant damage, or half as much on a successful save. Magical darkness in the area is dispelled.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wizard casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as their spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

action.name: Prismatic Blast
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage of one particular type chosen by the wizard: cold, fire, or lighting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The outcast casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as their spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The outcast makes two shadow bolt attacks.

action.name: Shadow Bolt
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the outcast's next turn.

bonus.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
entries: The outcast magically summons three {@creature dretch||dretches} or one {@creature quasit}. The summoned creatures appear in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the outcast, whom they obey. They take their turns immediately after the outcast. The demons remain for 1 hour, until it or the outcast dies, or until the outcast dismisses them as a bonus action.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the Scalebreaker knight is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Inspired Example
entries: Allies within 30 feet of the Scalebreaker knight have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Takedown
entries: When the Scalebreaker knight hits with a weapon attack against a flying creature, that creature must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Scalebreaker knight makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Scalebreaker Opening
entries: When an ally of the Scalebreaker knight makes an attack against a creature within 5 feet of the Scalebreaker knight, they can give that ally advantage on their attack.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Clawstrider Ranger casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as their spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Trained Mount
entries: While riding a mount, the Clawstrider Ranger has advantage on melee attack rolls against any unmounted creature that is smaller than its mount.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Clawstrider Ranger makes two melee or ranged attacks. If it makes both attacks against the same target, each attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The Clawstrider raptor has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of its allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the Clawstrider raptor moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the Clawstrider raptor can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Holy Weapons
entries: The paladin's weapon attacks are magical. When the paladin hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 2d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The paladin makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage when used in two hands to make a melee attack, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Lay on Hands (3/Day)
entries: The paladin touches another creature. The target magically regains 11 ({@dice 2d8 + 2}) hit points and is cured of one disease or the {@condition poisoned} condition.

action.name: Summon Steed (1/Day)
entries: The paladin magically summons a warhorse. The summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of the paladin, whom they obey. It takes its turn immediately before or after the paladin. The warhorse remains until it or the paladin dies, or until the paladin dismisses it as an action.

reaction.name: Deny the Witch (3/Day)
entries: The paladin targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it that is casting a spell. If the spell is 3rd level or lower, the spell fails, but any spell slots or charges are not wasted.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The mercenary has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Steelfang's Curse
entries: If bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage reduces the mercenary to 0 hit points, it drops to 1 hit point instead unless the damage was from a silvered weapon.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mercenary makes two battleaxe attacks or two claw attacks, and one bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: The mercenary magically transforms into a wolf, or back into its true form, while retaining their game statistics. This transformation ends if the mercenary is reduced to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

trait.name: Marksman
entries: The ranger adds +2 to attack and damage rolls with ranged weapons (already included in the stat block).

trait.name: Vantage Point (3/Day)
entries: When the ranger makes a ranged weapon attack against a creature, they may grant themselves advantage on the attack roll if they are 20 feet or more above the target vertically and that creature doesn't have cover.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Dash
entries: The ranger may take the Dash action as a bonus action on their turn.

trait.name: Cat-like Reflexes
entries: The Lion Guard can take a reaction each turn in combat.

trait.name: Cat's Paws
entries: When the Lion Guard hits a creature with an opportunity attack, that creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Instinct
entries: The Lion Guard cannot be {@status surprised} while it is conscious.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Lion Guard makes two attacks.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Sudden Strike
entries: When a creature the Lion Guard can see moves into their reach, the Lion Guard makes one attack against the creature.

trait.name: Gutripper
entries: Creatures reduced to zero hit points by Rickard Steelfang's attacks are violently disemboweled and die.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: Rickard Steelfang has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Rickard Steelfang regains any lost hit points at the start of each of his turns, and ignores any effect which prevents him from regaining hit points. If Rickard Steelfang takes damage from an inherited silver weapon (see sidebar), this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. He dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Scent of Blood (Wolf Form Only)
entries: Rickard Steelfang always knows the location of a creature he has wounded in the last 24 hours. He has advantage on attack rolls against any target that is not at maximum hit points.

trait.name: Steelfang's Curse
entries: During a full moon, Rickard Steelfang is forced into his wolf-humanoid form. During this time, he is driven into a violent rage where he is hostile to all other creatures and must attack them on each of his turns if he is able to do so.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rickard Steelfang makes three battleaxe or claw attacks. He makes two additional bite attacks against a {@condition prone} target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d4 + 6}) slashing damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

bonus.name: Change Shape
entries: Rickard Steelfang polymorphs into a Large wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a Large dire wolf, or back into his true form. His statistics, except for his size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. He reverts to his true form if he dies.

reaction.name: Ravage (Wolf Form Only)
entries: Whenever Rickard Steelfang is hit with an attack, he may immediately make a bite attack with advantage against the attacking creature. If he hits, the target is knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Rickard Steelfang makes one melee attack.

legendary.name: Rip and Tear (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Rickard can move up to his speed. At the end of this movement, he makes one claw attack against each creature within his reach.

trait.name: Aura of Victory
entries: While he is not {@condition incapacitated}, allies of Uriel Radley within 30 feet of him have resistance to all damage and advantage on all saving throws.

trait.name: High Paladin
entries: Uriel Radley adds his Charisma modifier (+5) to his Armor Class and all saving throws (included in the statistics above).

trait.name: Holy Weapons
entries: Uriel Radley's weapon attacks are magical. When he hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 4d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Weight of Sin
entries: Creatures knocked {@condition prone} by Uriel Radley cannot stand up unless they spend an action and make a successful {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw, or another creature uses their action to help them stand.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Uriel Radley makes two melee or ranged attacks.

action.name: Judge
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., or range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from Uriel Radley and knocked {@condition prone}. After making a ranged attack with this weapon, it magically teleports back into Uriel Radley's hands.

action.name: Lay on Hands (3/Day)
entries: Uriel touches another creature. The target magically regains 21 ({@dice 4d8 + 2}) hit points and is cured of one disease or the {@condition poisoned} condition.

action.name: Summon Steed (1/Day)
entries: Uriel magically summons a {@creature nightmare} (except it is a lawful good celestial, not an evil fiend, but this does not change its appearance). The summoned creature appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of Uriel, whom it obeys. It takes its turn immediately before or after the paladin. The nightmare remains until it or Uriel dies, or until Uriel dismisses it as an action.

bonus.name: Gaze of Penance {@recharge}
entries: Uriel Radley locks his vision against another creature he can see who can see him and forces the creature to confront its crimes and misdeeds. The target must make a {@dc 18} saving throw. It can use either its Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma to make this save, but must use whichever saving throw has the lowest bonus. On a failed save, the target takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) psychic damage, and is {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, and {@condition restrained} for 1 minute or until it takes 100 points of damage. This effect also ends early if remove curse or greater restoration are cast on the target.
If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Uriel Radley's Gaze of Penance for the next 24 hours.

reaction.name: Deny the Witch (3/Day)
entries: Uriel targets one creature he can see within 60 feet of him that is casting a spell. If the spell is 5th level or lower, the spell fails, but any spell slots or charges are not wasted.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Uriel Radley makes one melee or ranged attack.

legendary.name: Fiery Step
entries: Uriel Radley teleports 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see within bright light.

legendary.name: Drop the Hammer (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Uriel Radley makes one melee attack against a {@condition prone} creature. On a hit, the target takes 70 ({@dice 20d6}) additional radiant damage. If the target has at least one head and Uriel Radley rolled a 20 on the attack roll, the target's head is crushed and dies if it can't survive without that head. A target is immune to this effect if it is immune to radiant damage, has legendary actions, or is Huge or larger.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Academy Director casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as their spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If an Academy Director fails a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Academy Director has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Each Academy Director wears a {@item robe of the archmagi} and a {@item ring of spell storing}, and carries a {@item staff of the magi}, and a {@item ring of spell storing}. They carry {@dice 2d6} legendary spell scrolls and potions. Bonuses from this equipment are included in the stat block.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Academy Director uses octarine blast twice. They can replace one use of arcane blast with Spellcasting instead.

action.name: Staff of the Magi
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Octarine Blast
entries: The Academy Director chooses fire, cold, lightning, acid, or poison damage, and hurls a beam of energy at a creature or object they can see. The creature or object must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. The target takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) damage of the chosen type on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

bonus.name: Arcane Step
entries: The Academy Director magically teleports to an unoccupied space within 120 feet of them.

reaction.name: Arcane Denial
entries: The Academy Director targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it that is casting a spell. If the spell is 5th level or lower, the spell fails, but any spell slots or charges are not wasted.

reaction.name: Ultimate Contingency (1/Day)
entries: When targeted by an attack or spell, or included in the area of the spell, the Academy Director can cast any spell in the Core Rules of 8th level or lower without any components, interrupting (and potentially avoiding) the triggering effect. The spell's normal casting time changes to 1 reaction.

legendary.name: Octarine Blast
entries: The Academy Director uses its octarine blast attack.

legendary.name: Arcane Step
entries: The Academy Director uses its arcane step bonus action.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Academy Director casts a spell.

variant.name: Academy Director Variants
entries: The eight members of the Amethyst Academy directorate are the mightiest arcane spellcasters upon the earth.
Feel free to add, modify, or change the spells available to the Academy Directors to customize them further:
Xel'vohca the Ancient gains the following traits:

items: His creature type changes to Undead
He has the following traits from the lich in the Core Rules: paralyzing touch, turn resistance, rejuvenation, damage resistances, damage immunities, and condition immunities.

entries: Zodiac Alisight gains the following traits:

items: His creature type is Giant, his size is Huge, and he has a Strength score of 25 (+7). Increase his hit points to 315 ({@dice 30d12 + 90})
His Challenge Rating is 23.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Amaranthyst casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as their spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks):

3e: {@spell vanish to the space between worlds|GuideDrakkenheim}
1e: {@spell banish to the space between worlds|GuideDrakkenheim}

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Delirium Healing
entries: As an action, Amaranthyst can touch a delirium shard to regain 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points. Once Amaranthyst has used a delirium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
entries: Amaranthyst is immune to contamination and is immune to any contaminated spell unless they choose to be affected by it.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Amaranthyst can use its Spellcasting trait once. They then make three attacks: one with their bite and two with their claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Octarine Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon breathes a cone of prismatic rays. Each ray is a different color and has a different power and purpose. Each creature in a 90-foot cone must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw. For each target, roll a {@dice d8} to determine which color ray affects it.

rows: The target takes {@damage 6d12} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.
The target takes {@damage 6d12} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.
The target takes {@damage 6d12} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.
The target takes {@damage 6d12} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.
The target takes {@damage 6d12} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

At the start of each of its turns, the affected target uses all its movement to move directly towards the closest creature it can see. Then, the affected target uses its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, the affected target does nothing this turn. At the end of each of its turns, the affected target can make a Wisdom saving throw. If it succeeds, this effect ends for that target.

At the start of each of its turns, the affected target gains 1 level of contamination. At the end of each of its turns, an affected target can make a Constitution saving throw. If it succeeds, this effect ends for that target.
The target is struck by an additional ray. Roll on this table twice more. There's no limit to how many additional rays can strike a single creature in this manner.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than their own, or back into their true form. They revert to their true form if they die. Any equipment they are wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains their alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Their statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

bonus.name: Arcane Step
entries: Amaranthyst magically teleports to an unoccupied space within 120 feet.

reaction.name: Arcane Denial
entries: Amaranthyst targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it that is casting a spell. If the spell is 5th level or lower, the spell fails, but any spell slots or charges are not wasted.

reaction.name: Ultimate Contingency (1/Day)
entries: When targeted by an attack or spell, or included in the area of the spell, Amaranthyst can cast any spell in the Core Rules of 8th level or lower without any components, interrupting (and potentially avoiding) the triggering effect. The spell's normal casting time changes to 1 reaction.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: Amaranthyst makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Arcane Step
entries: Amaranthyst uses its arcane step bonus action.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Amaranthyst casts a spell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Venus Joplin fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Long Live the King
entries: If damage reduces Venus Joplin to 0 hit points, one ally within 10 feet of her can choose to be reduced to 0 hit points. If they do, Venus Joplin drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Reactive
entries: Venus Joplin can take one reaction on every turn in combat.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Venus Joplin wears the Continental Crown of Caspia, and wields the House Joplin {@item Rapier|PHB}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Venus Joplin makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Joplin's Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Might of Caspia
entries: Venus Joplin or one ally she can see within 60 feet of her gain 25 temporary hit points.

reaction.name: Counterstrike
entries: In response to being targeted by a melee attack, Venus Joplin can make one melee weapon attack against her attacker. If her attack hits, the target makes its attack roll with disadvantage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Venus Joplin makes one melee attack.

legendary.name: Royal Command
entries: Venus Joplin targets one ally she can see within 60 feet of her. If the target can see and hear Venus Joplin, the target can make one weapon attack as a reaction and gains advantage on the attack roll.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Divine Matriarch casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as her spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Divine Awe
entries: Divine light shields the Divine Matriarch from harm. Once per turn when a creature hits the Divine Matriarch with an attack, the attacking creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 35 ({@damage 10d6}) radiant damage and become {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Holy Purpose
entries: The Divine Matriarch can't lose more than 50 hit points in a single combat round. If the Divine Matriarch is {@condition incapacitated} at the start of her turn, she can end that effect (no action required), but the only actions she can take that turn are Dash, Disengage, Dodge, or making one weapon attack.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Divine Matriarch fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage, and the target must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is consumed by holy flames until it spends an action to put them out. While consumed by holy flames, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, and takes 21 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Holy Fire
entries: The Divine Matriarch calls down a 10-foot-radius, 40-foot-high column of flame in an area up to 120 feet away from her. Each creature in the column must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

bonus.name: Decree of Justice
entries: The Divine Matriarch chooses one ally she can see within 60 feet of her. Until the start of the Divine Matriarch's next turn, that ally cannot lose hit points, cannot die, and is immune to all conditions, spells, or other magical abilities unless it chooses to be affected by them.

bonus.name: Flames of Righteousness
entries: The Divine Matriarch conjures a swirling vortex of spiritual flames around herself. They dance and blaze around her to a distance of 30 feet for 1 minute, or until the Divine Matriarch becomes {@condition incapacitated} or dies. When a hostile creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target suffers 23 ({@damage 5d8}) radiant damage, or half as much on a successful save.

legendary.name: Staff
entries: The Divine Matriarch makes a staff attack.

legendary.name: Holy Fire (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Divine Matriarch uses Holy Fire.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Divine Matriarch casts a spell.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The deep dreg can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Catch of the Day
entries: Once per turn, the deep dreg can deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to a {@condition prone} or {@condition restrained} creature it hits with a weapon attack.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
entries: As an action, the deep dreg can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
entries: This creature is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells.

trait.name: Normal Semblance
entries: The deep dreg has advantage on {@skill Deception} checks to pass itself off as a normal humanoid creature.

trait.name: Watery Camouflage
entries: The deep dreg has advantage on {@skill Stealth} checks to hide in any area obscured by murky water or aquatic features.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage when used in two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Net
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 5/15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained}. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 10} Strength check to free itself or another creature in a net, ending the effect on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 10) frees the target without harming it and destroys the net.

trait.name: Abyssal Aura
entries: While the deep knight is not {@condition incapacitated}, it and its allies within 30 feet who can see and hear it have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The deep knight can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
entries: As an action, the deep knight can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
entries: This creature is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells.

trait.name: Unwavering Sentinel
entries: Creatures provoke opportunity attacks from the deep knight even if they take the Disengage action before leaving its reach.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deep knight makes two attacks: one with its harpoon and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Harpoon
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the deep knight.

bonus.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Huge or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The deep siren casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as her spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks):

2e: {@spell vanish to the space between worlds|GuideDrakkenheim}

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The deep siren can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
entries: This creature is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. This creature can cast contaminated spells even though it does not gain contamination levels.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The siren makes two storm lash attacks.

action.name: Storm Lash
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 90 ft. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage, and the target is pushed up to 10 feet away from the siren.

action.name: Discordant Song (Recharges on a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The siren unleashes a cacophony of psychic screams. The magic erupts in a 30-foot-radius sphere originating from the siren. Each creature of the siren's choice in that area must make a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage, and suffers from discordant reverberations for 1 minute. During that time, it rolls a {@dice d6} and subtracts the number rolled from all its attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. The target can make an Intelligence saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Illusory Appearance
entries: The siren covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the siren takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.

bonus.name: Misty Step
entries: The siren magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it.

monster.name: The Duchess
languages: understands all languages but does not speak; telepathy 120 ft.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The duchess casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The Duchess can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Delerium Healing
entries: As an action, the Duchess can touch a delerium shard to regain 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points. Once a monster has used a delerium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
entries: The Duchess is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells. They can cast contaminated spells even though they do not gain contamination levels.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Duchess fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Duchess has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Moisture Regeneration
entries: The Duchess regains 20 hit points at the start of each of her turns if she is submerged at least partially in water. She dies only if she starts her turn at zero hit points and does not regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Duchess makes three tentacle attacks. If she is grappling a creature, she can make one bite attack as a bonus action against it.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). At the start of each of its turns until the grapple ends, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or gain Contamination Level. The Duchess can have up to four targets {@condition grappled} at a time.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Large or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the Duchess is thrown up to 60 feet in a direction of the Duchess's choice and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Deep Domination {@recharge 5}
entries: The Duchess targets one creature it can see. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by the Duchess until the Duchess dies.

reaction.name: Sacrificial Pawn
entries: When the Duchess takes damage from an attack, she can choose one ally or creature {@condition charmed} by she can see within 30 feet. That creature takes the damage from the attack.

legendary.name: Tentacle or Fling
entries: The Duchess makes one tentacle attack or uses fling.

legendary.name: Call of the Deep (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Duchess calls forth up to five {@creature deep dreg|GuideDrakkenheim|deep dregs} or one {@creature deep knight|GuideDrakkenheim}. The creatures appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of the Duchess and remain until destroyed. These creatures act after the Duchess on the same initiative count and are under her control.

monster.name: Striga
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The striga has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The striga regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight. If the striga takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function until the start of the striga's next turn.

trait.name: Delirium Healing
entries: As an action, the striga can touch a delirium shard to regain 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points. Once the striga has used a delirium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
entries: The striga is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The striga can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: The striga takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The striga makes three attacks, two with its claws and one with its bite. If both claw attacks hit the same creature, that creature must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@dice 4d6}) extra necrotic damage and gain 1 Contamination Level.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Entropic Watcher
languages: understands all languages but does not speak; telepathy 120 ft.

trait.name: Delirium Healing
entries: As an action, the entropic watcher can touch a delirium shard to regain 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points. Once the entropic watcher has used a delirium shard in this way, the shard can't be used in this manner again for 24 hours.

trait.name: Fully Contaminated
entries: The entropic watcher is immune to contamination, and has advantage on saving throws against contaminated spells.

trait.name: Eldritch Blood
entries: A creature within 5 feet of the entropic watcher takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic damage whenever it hits the watcher with a melee attack.

trait.name: Eldritch Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the entropic watcher's darkvision.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the entropic watcher fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The entropic watcher has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Withering Gaze
entries: The entropic watcher's eye projects an area of withering magic in a 150-foot line that is 10 feet wide. At the start of each of its turns, the entropic watcher decides which way the line faces and whether the line is active. Creatures in the area of the line are vulnerable to necrotic damage and cannot regain hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The entropic watcher makes one insanity beam attack and four attacks with its tendrils. One or more tendril attacks can be replaced with a contaminating grasp attack instead.

action.name: Tendrils
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 40 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the entropic watcher can't use the same tendril on another target. The entropic watcher has ten tendrils.

action.name: Insanity Beam
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) necrotic damage, and the beam then leaps to another target. The watcher can repeat the attack against a new target within 30 feet of the first target. A creature can be targeted by only one of the beams each time the watcher uses this attack. For each additional creature hit in this way, the damage increases by 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Shadow Crash {@recharge 5}
entries: The entropic watcher unleashes a blast of entropy centered on a point it can see within 150 feet of it. Creatures within 20 feet of the point must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. They suffer {@damage 8d8} necrotic damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one.
